actionState.description: Stores the result of the last action on the service object.

adminStatus.description: Used to administratively activate or deactivate already deployed service object

operStatus.description: Used to indicate if the service entity is operational.

ownerID.description: ID of the owner of the object, can contain controllerID

statusReason.description: In case of ERROR actionState, it will have the reason for the error. Otherwise its empty. It is required to make create process to be asynchronous.

syncStatus.description: Used to indicate of the service entity is in sync or out of sync with the network

source_interfaces.description: The lifecycle interfaces define the essential, normative operations that each TOSCA Relationship Types may support.

operations.description: Operation to notify the target node of a source node which is now available via a relationship.
operations.name: add_source

operations.description: Operation to pre-configure the target endpoint.
operations.name: pre_configure_target

operations.description: Operation to post-configure the source endpoint.
operations.name: post_configure_source

operations.description: Operation to notify source some property or attribute of the target changed
operations.name: target_changed

operations.description: Operation to pre-configure the source endpoint.
operations.name: pre_configure_source

operations.description: Operation to post-configure the target endpoint.
operations.name: post_configure_target

operations.description: Operation to remove a target node.
operations.name: remove_target

operations.description: Operation to notify the source node of a target node being added via a relationship.
operations.name: add_target

artifact_types.description: This is the default (root) TOSCA Artifact Type definition that all other TOSCA base Artifact Types derive from.
artifact_types.name: tosca.artifacts.Root

artifact_types.description: This artifact type represents the parent type for all implementation artifacts in TOSCA. These artifacts are used to implement operations of TOSCA interfaces either directly (e.g., scripts) or indirectly (e.g., config. files).
artifact_types.name: tosca.artifacts.Implementation

artifact_types.description: mapping between property of TOSCA node instance and data model used by swagger API
artifact_types.name: sdno.artifacts.Implementation.ToscaSwaggerMapper

artifact_types.description: This artifact type represents a Bash script type that contains Bash commands that can be executed on the Unix Bash shell.
artifact_types.name: tosca.artifacts.Implementation.Bash

artifact_types.description: This artifact type represents a Python file that contains Python language constructs that can be executed within a Python interpreter.
artifact_types.name: tosca.artifacts.Implementation.Python

artifact_types.description: This artifact type represents the parent type for all deployment artifacts in TOSCA. This class of artifacts typically represents a binary packaging of an application or service that is used to install/create or deploy it as part of a node's lifecycle.
artifact_types.name: tosca.artifacts.Deployment

artifact_types.description: This artifact represents the parent type for all Virtual Machine (VM) image and container formatted deployment artifacts. These images contain a stateful capture of a machine (e.g., server) including operating system and installed software along with any configurations and can be run on another machine using a hypervisor which virtualizes typical server (i.e., hardware) resources.
artifact_types.name: tosca.artifacts.Deployment.Image.VM

artifact_types.description: This artifact type represents a parent type for any "image" which is an opaque packaging of a TOSCA Node's deployment (whether real or virtual) whose contents are typically already installed and pre-configured (i.e., "stateful") and prepared to be run on a known target container.
artifact_types.name: tosca.artifacts.Deployment.Image

artifact_types.description: This artifact type is used when an artifact definition needs to have its associated file simply treated as a file and no special handling/handlers are invoked (i.e., it is not treated as either an implementation or deployment artifact type).
artifact_types.name: tosca.artifacts.File

capability_types.description: This is the default (root) TOSCA Capability Type definition that all other TOSCA Capability Types derive from.
capability_types.name: tosca.capabilities.Root

capability_types.description: The Container capability, when included on a Node Type or Template definition, indicates that the node can act as a container for (or a host for) one or more other declared Node Types.
capability_types.name: tosca.capabilities.Container

capability_types.description: This is the default TOSCA type that should be used or extended to define an attachment capability of a (logical) infrastructure device node (e.g., BlockStorage node).
capability_types.name: tosca.capabilities.Attachment

capability_types.description: This is the default TOSCA type that should be used or extended to define a network endpoint capability. This includes the information to express a basic endpoint with a single port or a complex endpoint with multiple ports. By default the Endpoint is assumed to represent an address on a private network unless otherwise specified.
capability_types.name: tosca.capabilities.Endpoint

capability_types.description: This is the default TOSCA type that should be used or extended to define a specialized database endpoint capability.
capability_types.name: tosca.capabilities.Endpoint.Database

capability_types.description: This is the default TOSCA type that should be used or extended to define a specialized administrator endpoint capability.
capability_types.name: tosca.capabilities.Endpoint.Admin

capability_types.description:
This capability represents a public endpoint which is accessible to the general internet (and its public IP address ranges).
This public endpoint capability also can be used to create a floating (IP) address that the underlying network assigns from a pool allocated from the application's underlying public network. This floating address is managed by the underlying network such that can be routed an application's private address and remains reliable to internet clients.
capability_types.name: tosca.capabilities.Endpoint.Public

capability_types.description: This is the default TOSCA type that should be used to express a scalability capability for a node.
capability_types.name: tosca.capabilities.Scalable

capability_types.description: This is the default TOSCA type that should be used to express an Operating System capability for a node.
capability_types.name: tosca.capabilities.OperatingSystem

capability_types.description: The Node capability indicates the base capabilities of a TOSCA Node Type.
capability_types.name: tosca.capabilities.Node

capability_types.description: A node type that includes the Bindable capability indicates that it can be bound to a logical network association via a network port.
capability_types.name: tosca.capabilities.network.Bindable

capability_types.description: A node type that includes the Linkable capability indicates that it can be pointed by tosca.relationships.network.LinksTo relationship type.
capability_types.name: tosca.capabilities.network.Linkable

group_types.description: This is the default (root) TOSCA Group Type definition that all other TOSCA base Group Types derive from.
group_types.name: tosca.groups.Root

interface_types.description: This is the default (root) TOSCA Interface Type definition that all other TOSCA Interface Types derive from.
interface_types.name: tosca.interfaces.Root

interface_types.description: The lifecycle interfaces define the essential, normative operations that each TOSCA Relationship Types may support.
interface_types.name: tosca.interfaces.relationship.Configure

interface_types.description: This lifecycle interface defines the essential, normative operations that TOSCA nodes may support.
interface_types.name: tosca.interfaces.node.lifecycle.Standard

node_types.description: The TOSCA Root Node Type is the default type that all other TOSCA base Node Types derive from. This allows for all TOSCA nodes to have a consistent set of features for modeling and management (e.g., consistent definitions for requirements, capabilities and lifecycle interfaces).
node_types.name: tosca.nodes.Root

node_types.description:
The TOSCA Port node represents a logical entity that associates between Compute and Network normative types.
The Port node type effectively represents a single virtual NIC on the Compute node instance.
node_types.name: tosca.nodes.network.Port

node_types.description: The TOSCA ObjectStorage node represents storage that provides the ability to store data as objects (or BLOBs of data) without consideration for the underlying filesystem or devices.
node_types.name: tosca.nodes.ObjectStorage

node_types.description: The TOSCA Network node represents a simple, logical network service.
node_types.name: tosca.nodes.network.Network

node_types.description: The TOSCA Load Balancer node represents logical function that be used in conjunction with a Floating Address to distribute an application's traffic (load) across a number of instances of the application (e.g., for a clustered or scaled application).
node_types.name: tosca.nodes.LoadBalancer

node_types.description: The TOSCA SoftwareComponent node represents a generic software component that can be managed and run by a TOSCA Compute Node Type.
node_types.name: tosca.nodes.SoftwareComponent

node_types.description: The TOSCA WebApplication node represents a software application that can be managed and run by a TOSCA WebServer node. Specific types of web applications such as Java, etc. could be derived from this type.
node_types.name: tosca.nodes.WebApplication

node_types.description: The TOSCA DBMS node represents a typical relational, SQL Database Management System software component or service.
node_types.name: tosca.nodes.DBMS

node_types.description: The TOSCA Container Runtime node represents operating system-level virtualization technology used to run multiple application services on a single Compute host.
node_types.name: tosca.nodes.Container.Runtime

node_types.description: This TOSCA WebServer Node Type represents an abstract software component or service that is capable of hosting and providing management operations for one or more WebApplication nodes.
node_types.name: tosca.nodes.WebServer

node_types.description: The TOSCA Database node represents a logical database that can be managed and hosted by a TOSCA DBMS node.
node_types.name: tosca.nodes.Database

node_types.description: The TOSCA Compute node represents one or more real or virtual processors of software applications or services along with other essential local resources. Collectively, the resources the compute node represents can logically be viewed as a (real or virtual) "server".
node_types.name: tosca.nodes.Compute

node_types.description: The SDNO Node Type all other SDNO base Node Types derive from
node_types.name: sdno.node.Root

node_types.description: It represents the outward customer-facing aspects of the edge-port functions that access the forwarding capabilities provided by the Node. Hence it provides a limited, simplified view of interest to external clients,  that enable the clients to request connectivity without the need to understand the provider network internals.
node_types.name: sdno.node.ServiceEndPoint

node_types.description: Attach Circuit
node_types.name: sdno.node.ServiceEndPoint.AC

node_types.description: It represents the ingress/egress port aspects that access the forwarding function provided  by the Connection.
node_types.name: sdno.node.ConnectionEndPoint

node_types.description: Attach Circuit
node_types.name: sdno.node.ConnectionEndPoint.Tp

node_types.description: It represents the inward network-facing aspects of the edge-port functions that access the forwarding capabilities provided by the Node.
node_types.name: sdno.node.NodeEdgePoint

node_types.description: It represents a network element which can be managed remotely (through controller or not). Sometimes called managed element.
node_types.name: sdno.node.Node

node_types.description: It represents an “intent-like” request for connectivity between two or more ServiceEndPoints. As such, ConnectivityService is a container for connectivity request details and is distinct  from the Connection that realizes the request
node_types.name: sdno.node.ConnectivityService

node_types.description: The Connection represents an enabled potential for forwarding between two or more connectionEndPoints
node_types.name: sdno.node.Connection

node_types.description: The TOSCA Container Application node represents an application that requires Container-level virtualization technology.
node_types.name: tosca.nodes.Container.Application

policy_types.description: This is the default (root) TOSCA Policy Type definition that all other TOSCA base Policy Types derive from.
policy_types.name: tosca.policies.Root

policy_types.description: This is the default (root) TOSCA Policy Type definition that is used to govern placement of TOSCA nodes or groups of nodes.
policy_types.name: tosca.policies.Placement

policy_types.description: This is the default (root) TOSCA Policy Type definition that is used to govern update of TOSCA nodes or groups of nodes.
policy_types.name: tosca.policies.Update

policy_types.description: This is the default (root) TOSCA Policy Type definition that is used to declare performance requirements for TOSCA nodes or groups of nodes.
policy_types.name: tosca.policies.Performance

policy_types.description: This is the default (root) TOSCA Policy Type definition that is used to govern scaling of TOSCA nodes or groups of nodes.
policy_types.name: tosca.policies.Scaling

relationship_types.description: This is the default (root) TOSCA Relationship Type definition that all other TOSCA Relationship Types derive from.
relationship_types.name: tosca.relationships.Root

relationship_types.description: This type represents an attachment relationship between two nodes. For example, an AttachesTo relationship type would be used for attaching a storage node to a Compute node.
relationship_types.name: tosca.relationships.AttachesTo

relationship_types.description: This type represents a network connection relationship between two nodes.
relationship_types.name: tosca.relationships.ConnectsTo

relationship_types.description: This type represents an intentional network routing between two Endpoints in different networks.
relationship_types.name: tosca.relationships.RoutesTo

relationship_types.description: This type represents a hosting relationship between two nodes.
relationship_types.name: tosca.relationships.HostedOn

relationship_types.description: The relationship specifies which ConnectionEndPonts are terminating the Connection. The association of the Connection to ConnectionEndPoints is made via the Ports of the Connection, where each Port of the Connection has a role and directionality in the context of the Connection.
relationship_types.name: sdno.relationship.ConnectionEndPoint

relationship_types.description: The relationship specifies which ServiceEndPoints are terminating the ConnectivityService. The association of the ConnectivityService to ServiceEndPoints is made via the Ports of the ConnectivityService, where each Port of the ConnectivityService has a role and directionality in the context of the ConnectivityService.
relationship_types.name: sdno.relationship.ServiceEndPoint

relationship_types.description: The relationship specifies what Node the Endpoint is hosted on.
relationship_types.name: sdno.relationship.HostedOn

relationship_types.description: The relationship specifies what Connenctions are Connectivity Services or Connections realized from.
relationship_types.name: sdno.relationship.RealizedBy

relationship_types.description: This type represents a general dependency relationship between two nodes.
relationship_types.name: tosca.relationships.DependsOn

relationship_types.description: This relationship type represents an association relationship between Port and Network node types.
relationship_types.name: tosca.relationships.network.LinksTo

relationship_types.description: This type represents a network association relationship between Port and Compute node types.
relationship_types.name: tosca.relationships.network.BindsTo

relationship_types.description: The relationship  represents a network association relationship between NodeEdgePoint and Network Node types
relationship_types.name: sdno.relationship.BindsTo
